title: Sales Product Manager, WW BPR
description:
Imagine what you could do here. The people here at Apple don’t just create products - they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it.

Apple’s Sales organization generates the revenue needed to fuel our ongoing development of products and services. This in turn, enriches the lives of hundreds of millions of people around the world. Our sales team, is in many ways, the face of Apple to our largest customers. We are here to grow Apple’s business through partnering with our enterprise, education & channel sales teams, resellers, partners and carriers.

We are looking for a strategic Product Manager to define and deliver user-centric solutions that drive business efficiency and adoption. You will collaborate with key stakeholders to define strategies, gather and translate business requirements, and lead end-to-end product development efforts. Leveraging advanced analytics and AI/ML capabilities, you will identify opportunities to streamline sales processes and deliver actionable insights.

Description

  • Partner with key business teams to define the product and solution strategy.

  • Engage with business users to understand requirements and deliver tools that meet their needs.

  • Apply appropriate statistical and analytical techniques to find opportunities to optimize sales processes.

  • Keep AI/ML vision at the core to optimize business processes and deliver next-best actions.

  • Obsess over the user interface and user experience on solutions

  • Lead product development projects from conception to execution, guiding technical teams in solution implementation.

  • Develop a closed-loop mechanism for gathering user feedback and planning product improvements.

  • Define and manage success metrics for deployment, usage, and adoption of products

In this role, you will:

  • Manage project communications, implement change management, and deliver training.

  • Lead and/or participate in cross-functional teams to address business complexity issues from an analysis and process perspective and be the focal point of contact for systems critical issues.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience solving complex technical challenges with large-scale platforms

Expertise in software development lifecycle (SDLC) project management and analysis is a plus (e.g., scoping, requirements gathering, documentation, design, development, user acceptance testing, change management, etc.)

Background leveraging technology to drive scale (with emphasis on AI and ML technologies) is a plus

Forward-thinking approach and tenacity to anticipate risks prior to partner concern and proactively drive towards a solution

High level of integrity, trust, and accountability to do what’s right

Outstanding attention to detail and organization skills

Master’s degree preferred

Minimum Qualifications

Typically requires a minimum of 8 years of product management, project management, program management, or similar function driving large scale complex business process/technology transformation initiatives

Proficient in design thinking techniques and tools (e.g., vision setting, product requirements documents, critical metrics, customer journey maps, roadmaps, etc.)

Outstanding communication skills with the ability to simplify complex ideas and effectively tailor approach to technical and non-technical audiences

Collaboration and negotiation skills, including previous experience gaining consensus across a variety of cross-functional and multi-directional partners to influence strategy and roadmap

Passion for continuous improvement with the curiosity to uncover gaps, resilience to lead ambiguity, and aim to create solutions to accelerate business growth

Experience working on enterprise-scale, multi-country digital transformation projects

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We seek to promote equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant .

title: Sr Manager, Product Management
description:
Position Type:
Location(s):
United States, San Diego, CA
Date Posted:
Job ID:
R-121851

Why PlayStation?

PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Group Corporation.

Senior Manager, Product Management: Elevating Storefront Experience

Location: San Diego, Los Angeles, or San Mateo, CA — or remote within the U.S.

About the Role

The Digital Commerce Experience Product team strives to develop top-tier customer and operator experiences for PlayStation’s digital stores. As Senior Manager, Product Management – Storefront Experience, you will lead a team of experienced product managers responsible for improving the end-to-end customer experience and expanding our storefront presence across geographies and channels. Reporting to the Senior Director, Digital Commerce Experience, you’ll work closely with global cross-functional teams to deliver a world-class customer experience that drive player engagement and business growth.

What You’ll Do

  • Guide and Encourage: Supervise and nurture a team of product managers, establishing an ambitious product vision, strategy, and roadmap for PlayStation Storefront experiences on all platforms and touchpoints.
  • Develop the Future: Drive the global expansion roadmap for PlayStation’s Storefronts, ensuring consistency and excellence across geographies and digital channels.
  • Champion the Player: Leverage data, insights, and experimentation to optimize the customer journey—from discovery to purchase and beyond.
  • Collaborate and Align: Partner with Store Commercial, Marketing, and Program Management teams to define and enable the future content strategy for our D2C stores.
  • Innovate with Impact: Collaborate closely with Engineering, UX, and Research to develop intuitive, high-performing, and scalable solutions.
  • Ensure Global Readiness: Collaborate with Legal and Compliance to develop experiences that are locally optimized and globally compliant.
  • Measure What Matters: Define success metrics and continuously monitor, analyze, and improve product performance to drive measurable results.
  • Impact at a Large Scope: Transmit vision, strategy, and advancement among teams and leadership to uphold alignment and drive.

What We’re Looking For

  • Experience: 6+ years of product management experience, leading large-scale D2C eCommerce products or platforms.
  • Leadership: Proven track record of leading and delivering complex programs in global, matrixed organizations.
  • Collaboration: Proven track record of effective teamwork with business, engineering, compose, and participant teams.
  • Approach: A resilient, resourceful leader who thrives in ambiguity and drives clarity through action.
  • Expertise: Background in enterprise-level integrations and delivering end-to-end digital commerce experiences.
  • Communication: Outstanding storytelling and presentation skills, capable of influencing at all levels.
  • Proficient in managing various tasks efficiently within a fast-paced environment.
  • Product Experience: Hands-on experience with agile development practices. Familiarity with UX compose principles, personalization systems, and experimentation platforms.

Please refer to our Candidate Privacy Notice for more information about how we process your personal information, and your data protection rights.


At SIE, we consider several factors when setting each role’s base pay range, including the competitive benchmarking data for the market and geographic location.

Please note that the base pay range may vary in line with our hybrid working policy and individual base pay will be determined based on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location.

In addition, this role is eligible for SIE’s top-tier benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, matching 401(k), paid time off, wellness program and coveted employee discounts for Sony products. This role also may be eligible for a bonus package.


The estimated base pay range for this role is listed below.
$199,400—$299,200 USD

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy, maternity or parental status, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

title: Director Product Management, QSC Audio
description:
QSC is creating exceptional, people-centric experiences with the perfect balance of technology and creativity. Q-SYS, our innovative full stack audio, video and control platform, unifies data, devices and a cloud-first architecture, empowering organizations to deliver transformative AV experiences across built spaces. Building on the QSC legacy, QSC Audio delivers audio technology that empowers live entertainers and sound reinforcement professionals with the confidence to create and deliver memorable experiences for their audiences.

Atrius, Distech Controls and QSC are part of the Acuity Intelligent Spaces (AIS) business segment. Our mission is to make spaces smarter, safer and greener through our strategy of connecting the edge with the cloud using disruptive technologies that leverage data interoperability.

Acuity Inc. (NYSE: AYI) is a market-leading industrial technology company. We use technology to solve problems in spaces, light and more things to come. Through our two business segments, Acuity Brands Lighting (ABL) and Acuity Intelligent Spaces (AIS), we design, manufacture, and bring to market products and services that make a valuable difference in people’s lives.

We achieve growth through the development of innovative new products and services, including lighting, lighting controls, building management solutions, and an audio, video and control platform. We focus on customer outcomes and drive growth and productivity to increase market share and deliver superior returns. We look to aggressively deploy capital to grow the business and to enter attractive new verticals. Acuity Inc. is based in Atlanta, Georgia, with operations across North America, Europe and Asia. The Company is powered by approximately 13,000 dedicated and talented associates. Visit us at www.acuityinc.com.

Job Summary

As Director of Product Management, you will lead and develop a talented team towards achieving QSC’s product strategy and business goals for our portfolio of award-winning DSP-driven active loudspeakers, software control apps and accessories. You will be responsible for product portfolio performance, the growth and success of your product management team, development and maintenance of product roadmaps, and the execution of strategic initiatives. You will play a key leadership role in determining product strategy, setting direction, forming important partnerships, championing voice of the customer within the organization, and building a high-performance team. You must have a willingness to travel (up to 25%) including international travel. This role reports directly to QSC Audio executive leadership.


DRIVE EXECUTION OF THE PRODUCT STRATEGY

  • Establish and implement a short-term product roadmap and long-term product strategy, in collaboration with the sales, marketing, product development, and executive team to ensure successful execution of the company’s business strategy and financial goals.
  • Ensure on-schedule readiness of all phase-gate deliverables (market requirements, product requirements, software requirements and business case documents) for all pending development programs.
  • Bring clarity throughout the organization around short-term product roadmap and overall long-term product strategy. Socialize upcoming programs and risks to ensure cross-functional understanding of impact to their department.

Key Tasks & Responsibilities (Essential Functions)

BUILD EXCELLENCE WITHIN THE PRODUCT MANAGEMENT TEAM

  • Manage individuals across the product management team including recruiting, onboarding, third-party contracting, setting objectives, talent development and ensuring high performance of all team members in meeting execution milestones.
  • Oversee new product definition and ensure the User Experience and Out-of-Box Experience for all NPI products meet or exceed customer expectations.
  • Drive Market Research & Competitive Intelligence within the team, helping them to integrate outputs into strategic recommendations that guide decision-making & strategies.
  • Instill a team culture that achieves greater insight into user-requirements and target applications through market research; nurture a frequent cadence of focused VOC discussion with channel partners and targeted end-users to shape portfolio & individual product development. Additionally, conduct focus groups, end-user surveys and in-person customer visits.
  • Maintain a thorough understanding of competitive products’ current offerings and be able to effectively articulate our value proposition over the competition.
  • Improve process for monitoring NPI field beta testing and user acceptance initiatives
  • Work closely with our software development team, monitoring burn-down and aligning software releases with content and hardware releases.
  • Identify process and organizational bottlenecks and leveraging these opportunities to constantly improve efficiency.
  • Ensure that each team member’s product portfolio meets KPIs and aligns with overall business strategy and financial objectives.
  • Backfill any capability gaps within the team.

Other

PROMOTE STRONG CULTURE OF COLLABORATION

  • In partnership with Engineering leadership, develop a Technology Roadmap that aligns with the Product Portfolio Roadmap.
  • Facilitate working sessions with Product Management and Engineering leadership to ideate on new products, features, architectures. Drive technology and platform initiatives with the Engineering team to promote innovation and market disruption.
  • Identify and build third-party relationships in product and technology development. Develop a culture where third-party partners become an extension of the internal team.

SUPPORT MARKETING, TRAINING AND SALES ACTIVITIES (10%)

  • Provide the marketing and training functions with release-specific product positioning, value proposition, and performance specifications, to and reach the target audience.
  • Participate in trade events, dealer events, media articles, blogs, communities, and customer training to demonstrate thought leadership and enhance the brand image.
  • Conduct regular End-user and Channel partner visits to foster relationships and evangelize products

Skills and Minimum Experience Required

  • Industry-related Bachelor’s Degree or 10 years of experience within the professional audio industry, in the field of either product management, technical marketing, applications engineering support or sales management
  • Deep experience (minimum 10 years) within the professional audio industry as a manufacturer, integrator, consultant, end-user or marketer of professional audio products.
  • A demonstrated history of successfully contributing to new product development
  • Specialized knowledge of Professional audio applications, such as live sound reinforcement, AV integration, live recording/streaming, digital audio over IP, home recording, etc
  • Specialized knowledge of the Global professional audio market and nuanced understanding of international channels
  • Proficient with agile software methodology and Atlassian software tools (Confluence, Jira, etc.)
  • Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint. Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite is highly desirable
  • Conduct annual performance reviews and sets smart goals for each upcoming year
  • Budget & coordinate individual and team training to drive excellence and build new capabilities within the Product management function
  • Budget & approve team travel. This includes Product Management participation in trade shows, regional & national events, sales events & meetings, dealer events, and other related activities as deemed necessary

Physical Requirements

  • Sedentary Work

Travel Requirements

  • 21-40%

QSC. is owned by Acuity Inc., which is located in the United States. These companies share a global recruitment system on which the data you provide will be stored, and which will be subject to the laws of the United States of America.


The range for this position is $165,000 to $230,000. Placement within this range may vary, depending on the applicant’s experience and geographic location. Acuity offers generous benefits including health care, dental coverage, vision plans, 401K benefits, and commissions/incentive compensation depending on role. For a list of our benefits, click here.


We value diversity and are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regards to race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity or national origin, disability, pregnancy, religion, covered veteran status, protected genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.


Accommodation for Applicants with Disabilities: As an equal opportunity employer, Acuity Inc. is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in its application process for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans. If you have difficulty using our online system due to a disability and need accommodation, you may contact us at (770) 922-9000. Please clearly indicate what type of accommodation you are requesting and for what requisition.

Any unsolicited resumes sent to Acuity Inc. from a third party, such as an Agency recruiter, including unsolicited resumes sent to an Acuity Inc. mailing address, fax machine or email address, directly to Acuity Inc. employees, or to Acuity Inc. resume database will be considered Acuity Inc. property. Acuity Inc. will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

Acuity Inc. will consider any candidate for whom an Agency has submitted an unsolicited resume to have been referred by the Agency free of any charges or fees. This includes any Agency that is an approved/engaged vendor, but does not have the appropriate approvals to be engaged on a search.

title: AI/ML Product Manager, WW CSO
description:
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish!

Apple's WW Channel Strategy and Operations (CSO) organization is a hub of innovation, focused on delivering an extraordinary customer experience and driving Apple's channel sales worldwide. We are a team with deep functional expertise that collaborates with cross-functional groups to build the future of sales enablement.

We’re looking for a visionary Product Manager to lead the creation of a revolutionary decision support system. This is not just another tool; it's a strategic platform that will redefine how our teams take critical decisions that create meaningful business impact. You will be at the helm, shaping a product that combines next-generation AI/ML capabilities with an advanced LLM interface to deliver a novel, intuitive, and powerful user experience. You will be the driver of the product vision, turning complex data and powerful technology into simple, elegant solutions.

Description

In this role, you serve as the unifying thread - anchoring business needs while partnering with world-class engineering, data science, and design teams to define, build, and launch a system that leverages next-gen AI/ML models and a groundbreaking LLM-powered interface. ","responsibilities":"Drive clarity and momentum-Keep teams moving forward with a defined and prioritized product vision and strategy, translated into a concrete, actionable roadmap that inspires and aligns teams.

Flex with intention-Comfortably drive multiple initiatives while making tough prioritization calls without compromising quality or speed.

Resolve ambiguity with structure and focus-Leverage your deep understanding of the AI/ML product development lifecycle and experience defining and launching products that leverage AI/ML, NLP, or Large Language Models to solve real-world business problems. Engage in deep technical discussions with engineering and data science teams on topics like model feasibility, data architecture, and technical trade-offs.

Simplify the complex-Apply exceptional written, verbal, and presentation skills, with an ability to distill intricate technical and strategic concepts into clear, persuasive language for diverse audiences, from engineers to executives.

Advocate for the user-Translate user needs into effective product solutions, guided by empathy for users, coupled with a passion for creating intuitive, elegant, and novel user experiences..

Keep business tied to all decisions-Utilize strong analytical skills with the ability to define product KPIs, analyze user data, and make data-informed product decisions and prioritization trade-offs.

Develop and own the product vision, strategy, and multi-year roadmap for our next-generation decision support system.

Author clear and concise product requirement documents (PRDs), epics, and user stories that effectively guide the development team.

Define and prioritize features, balancing user needs, technical feasibility, and business value to ensure we are always working on what matters most.

Define and analyze metrics that inform the success of the product, monitor its performance, and provide insights for future iteration.

Communicate the product strategy, roadmap, and progress to stakeholders at all levels, ensuring alignment and building excitement for your vision.

Formulate a strategy for continuous iteration and improvement based on quantitative data and qualitative user feedback working with cross functional business partners.

Partner with Sales, Finance marketing, Product Marketing, Legal, and IS&T to deliver a cohesive and impactful product experience from end to end.

Preferred Qualifications

10+ years of experience in product management, with a proven track record of shipping complex, data-intensive, AI/ML products from concept to launch in a large, global enterprise.

5+ years of experience working in a global or geo role is highly preferred.

Deeply collaborative - Builds strong relationships; thrives in cross-functional environments.

Calm under pressure - Brings clarity and steadiness in fast-moving, high-stakes situations.

Skilled in navigating complexity - Simplifies ambiguous challenges while keeping sight of details.

Energizing and intuitive partner - Spots gaps, asks the right questions, and helps teams move forward with confidence. Energizing partner who helps teams stay inspired.

Flexible - Adjusts approach based on project needs, partner styles, and shifting priorities.

Strong communicator - Explains clearly and effectively to partners, including technical teams.

BS/MS degree preferred

Minimum Qualifications

5+ years of experience in product management, with a proven track record of successful product launches.

Proven ability to translate business needs and user problems into clear, well-defined product requirements and user stories.

Experience with the full product lifecycle, from ideation and research to launch and iteration.

Excel at understanding user pain points and motivations, and using those insights to guide product development and build user trust.

High degree of flexibility, adaptability, and comfort with ambiguity in rapidly evolving technological landscapes.

Proven understanding of business KPIs and how to connect product outcomes to business impact.

Demonstrates the highest level of ethics, values, integrity, and trust.

Solid track record of meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

title: Product Manager, Creative Apps Core Experience
description:
As a member of our Worldwide Product Marketing group, you’ll represent the customer throughout a product’s journey from concept through development and launch. You’ll develop and apply insights to help infuse innovative features into our product-development process. Together with our team, you’ll work to craft groundbreaking ideas into tangible products that excite the world.

At Apple, we combine product management, product development, and product marketing responsibilities into a single, cross functional Product Management role that collaborates with design, engineering, finance, legal, marketing communications, public relations, market research, sales, and support for maximum impact across the organization. We are seeking a dynamic, successful Product Manager focused on driving the development of core experiences across Apple’s Creative Apps team - the group that helps bring products like Final Cut Pro, Logic Pro, GarageBand, Pages, Keynote, and more to creators around the world. This includes working both inbound and outbound to drive the development, introduction, and maintenance of core workflows, features, and technologies. We are looking for a passionate person to join this amazing team and if you feel this is you, we'd love to hear from you.

Description

In this role you will:

  • Collaborate with software engineering and product designers to define the strategy and roadmap for core experiences across Apple’s creative apps.

  • Author product requirements and drive the development of new onboarding journeys, learning content, and distribution platforms.

  • Research and synthesize technology trends, the creative apps landscape, and user feedback to identify new product and partnership opportunities.

  • Negotiate and influence product trade-offs impacting schedule and usability to improve user experience and differentiation.

  • Position our apps in the competitive landscape and craft compelling end-user messaging for the highest impact.

  • Transform market and customer insights into inspiring narratives that engage internal teams and shape the product vision.

  • Launch new features in conjunction with marketing communications, public relations and other product marketing teams.

Preferred Qualifications

Strong track record of leading product development cycles and partnering closely with engineering/technical teams from an in-bound marketing perspective.

Best-in-class oral and written communication skills, as well as demonstrated success as a product spokesperson on a national or global level.

Ability to lead through influence, debate, and storytelling.

Deep understanding of creative process, software, and workflows across artistic disciplines including music and video creation, photo editing, and visual design.

Keen sense of cultural relevance, emerging trends, and consumer tastes in the creative industry.

Passion for creative arts, including photography, film, music, literature and design.

MS/MA/MBA preferred.

Minimum Qualifications

4+ years Product Management experience with at least one entire product development cycle from concept to introduction.

Experience with consumer creative software products and technologies.

BS/BA degree in marketing/business/engineering or equivalent relevant professional experience.

title: Sr. Product Manager - Territory Assignment and Compensation
description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
The Product Manager is in charge of guiding prioritization, planning, and implementation of large-scale tech solutions. This responsibility includes collaborating with internal team members from Sales, Operations, Strategy, and Finance to gather and prioritize crucial business requirements for territory allocations and compensation plans.

Are you enthusiastic about Sales Territory Building and Compensation Accounting policies, the technical features of CRM systems, and the individuals who use them? This position provides an outstanding chance to collaborate with internal collaborators in Sales, Operations, Strategy, and Finance to collect and rank essential business needs. You will assist in shaping the Territory Assignments and Compensation vision and plan in coordination with other Product Managers at Adobe. Collaborate with Product Managers, System Analysts, and Development teams to create, develop, and implement technology solutions that offer outstanding user experiences and predict future requirements using AI and current product management methods.
What You’ll Do

Partner with the business to understand current and future needs to deliver high-value technical solutions that improve both user experience and operational efficiency.

Communicate and align with internal partners on plans and launches, highlighting both immediate solutions and future-forward innovations.

Lead the planning and delivery of operational requirements while championing a fresh method.

Partner with cross-functional teams and product managers to deliver interdependent solutions and initiatives.

Collaborate with teams responsible for coordinating and managing systems, ensuring data integrity, and exploring opportunities for AI/ML models to improve workflows.

Facilitate process improvement sessions to synthesize findings and feedback into an informed, future-focused experience build.

Support delivery work across multiple scrum teams and CRM systems.

Maintain and prioritize the product backlog, managing competing requests from various collaborators and user groups.

Support sprint planning and other scrum events as the Product Owner.

Contribute to the Product Roadmap and be responsible for the Delivery Plan.

Partner with Sales Operations and Technology Services to craft and optimize an unparalleled process.
What You Need to Succeed

3-5 years of product management experience and experience launching large-scale technology solutions while supporting organizational change.

Experience working in Sales CRM, forecasting, sales performance management, and the integration of ERP systems with CRMs.

Strategic approach linking platform capabilities to business outcomes and customer value.

Demonstrated curiosity and ability in exploring tools based on artificial intelligence, predictive analytics, or automation solutions to improve product impact.

Experience with recognizing recurring revenue in a subscription-based software model is greatly preferred.

Deep comprehension of revenue recognition metrics (ARR/credit measures), calculation concepts, and procedures for auditing and maintaining data accuracy.

Experience with Agile methodology and working within scrum teams.

Self-starter that thrives in the face of challenges.

Proven track record of operating effectively with general mentorship on new projects.

Outstanding communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences, including individual contributors, management, and executive leadership.

Experience presenting and advocating programs to internal partners and users.

Strong communication skills, with the distinctive ability to empower and influence people without authority or a direct reporting relationship.

Excellent negotiation, conflict management, and resolution skills – you respectfully facilitate teams to the successful mitigation of issues.

Preferable to have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent or relevant work experience, with CRM enablement.

Knowledge of customer master data structures and procedures for inspecting, and preserving data accuracy, while considering the application of AI to improve data precision and quality.
Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $111,000 -- $212,900 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.

At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).

In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

title: Photonics Test Product Manager (Quantifi Photonics, San Jose, CA)
description:
Our Purpose


TERADYNE, where experience meets innovation and driving excellence in every connection. We are fueled by creativity and diversity of thought and in our workforce. Our employees are supported to innovate and learn something new every day.

We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.


Opportunity Overview


Product Manager – Photonics Test Solutions


We are looking for a Product Manager to identify and bring new photonics test instruments and solutions to market. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with a strong background in photonics test and measurement and has a broad network of industry contacts.


Our industry is in a very exciting phase. Photonic IC technology is becoming mainstream, and the demand for bandwidth and higher speeds is insatiable due to the ever more dominant cloud technologies and the rise of artificial intelligence. Quantifi Photonics is ideally positioned to enable the cost-effective testing of these emerging technologies and is an industry leader for high volume testing in validation and manufacturing. The recent acquisition by Teradyne is a testament to its dominance in the industry and a gateway for further growth.


Your main responsibilities will be to work closely with our customers and identify new products and solutions, do broad market research and provide business cases, establish priorities, and cooperate with sales, marketing, engineering and operations to bring these new products and solutions to market. In addition, you will establish contact with leading customers in the industry, represent the company at industry events and promote the company’s products and solutions at trade shows and conferences. You will be measured on achieving revenue through new products and solutions, in addition to achieving a more competitive product and solutions portfolio.


Ideally, applicants will be based in the San Francisco Bay Are, however we are flexible about location for the right candidates. The job will include regular travel to customers worldwide.


Tasks and responsibilities

  • Identify new product and solution opportunities in close cooperation with customers and partners.
  • Perform market research and create business cases for these prospective products and solutions.
  • Lead and drive the New Product Introductions, maximizing revenue growth and minimizing time-to-market.
  • Create an atmosphere of teamwork among sales, marketing, engineering, operations and finance.
  • Maximize revenue from new products and solutions and take market share from competitors.
  • Create and maintain a product and solutions roadmap to drive your activities and maximize your success.
  • Interpret customer requirements and identify optimal solutions to meet those needs.
  • Build a large network of prospective customers in the target markets and maintain positive long-term relationships with key customers.
  • Cooperate with key stake holders in the organization to be able to maximize your success.
  • Participate in industry standards.
  • Promote existing and new products to customers in person, at trade shows and online sales presentations.


All About You

We seek individuals who share our passion and determination. Our commitment to customer success drives us to go the extra mile. If you’re ready to join us in this mission, take a closer look at the minimum criteria for the position.


Candidate requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree and Master of Science in Photonics or equivalent.
  • At least 10 years of experience in a product management role.
  • Proven track record of successfully bringing new products and solutions to market.
  • Deep expertise in Photonics & High-Speed I/O test and measurement solutions.
  • Well-known individual in the industry.
  • Knowledge of PXI test solutions is a plus.
  • Good understanding of the photonics ecosystem.
  • Strong network of optical communication customers world-wide, such as start-ups, established companies, to advanced research institutes and universities.
  • Exceptional customer-facing, presentation and communication skills required.
  • Ability to develop strong customer relationships and communicate with tact and diplomacy.
  • A desire to become a trusted advisor to customers and interfacing regularly with key technical contacts and building contacts at all levels of an organization.
  • Comfortable working autonomously while setting and achieving ambitious goals.
  • Excellent organizational, time management, presentation and interpersonal skills.
  • Highly motivated and hard-charging individual to drive results.
  • A desire to win at an individual and team level.
  • Curiosity and desire to learn and share knowledge.
  • Fluent in English, written and spoken.
  • Travel up to 25%.


Compensation:
The base salary range for this role is $150,300-$240,500. This range is a good faith estimate, and the amount of base salary will correspond with experience and skill set. This range can also fluctuate depending on demand and location.


Incentive Plan: This job is eligible for discretionary bonus(es) based on financial performance.


Benefits:

Teradyne offers a variety of robust health and well-being benefit programs, including medical, dental, vision, Flexible Spending Accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance, paid vacation & holidays, tuition assistance programs, and more. Please click here to see details.


#LI-JL2

title: Senior Manager, Product Quality Management
description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com

Job Function:

Quality

Job Sub Function:

Quality Assurance

Job Category:

Professional

All Job Posting Locations:

Irvine, California, United States of America, Milpitas, California, United States of America

Job Description:

Johnson & Johnson Vision, a member of the Johnson & Johnson family of companies, is recruiting for a Senior Manager, Product Quality Management located in Irvine, CA (Preferred) or Milpitas, CA.

About MedTech

Fueled by innovation at the intersection of biology and technology, we’re developing the next generation of smarter, less invasive, more personalized treatments.

Your unique talents will help patients on their journey to wellness. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/medtech

Through partnership with Supply Chain (Ops, Value stream), R&D, QA, and commercial leadership, this position leads the monitoring, analysis and improvement of all aspects of brand quality from NPI through to the customer as well as the communication back to commercial on the brand health, to improve brand equity. In parallel to the field performance, work with regulatory and quality systems both at an operating company level and an enterprise level, to look at the health authorities’ compliance landscape and incorporate proactively in the improvement strategy.

As a result, the position leads the strategic 10-year overview quality plan per brand addressing patient needs, using a combination of new product and improvement approaches.

Key Responsibilities:

To act on the strategy, the position holds key quality decisions on the brands.

  • Partner with commercial organization, regional offices, Regulatory and Complaint handling to gather all short-and-long term information on the brands as they relate to performance in the field
  • For new products, partner with R&D leadership to modify the new product development to optimize product quality. Position has the accountability assess these launches as they relate to Product quality and has the scope to accelerate, modify or delay new product launches
  • For existing products, partner with Supply Chain Leadership to assess and implement modifications to the manufacturing processes and lead the strategy of manufacturing improvements as they relate to product quality.

In order to execute the strategy, the position relies on two Engineering groups who are dedicated to the Product Improvements: NPI Quality Engineering and Customer Experience Engineering. These groups represent over 20 engineers. They conduct the technology research, and implementation of the strategy led by Product Quality Management in synch with R&D and Supply chain engineering. The position will lead the over-arching CAPAs on the topic.

On the other side of the spectrum the position is also accountable for short-term brand decisions. Any brand-wide deviation from the design intent will be reviewed and assessed. Product decisions in these cases are co-owned with the site quality leader. Will have signature authority on non-conformances and change control for assigned product lines.

  • Accountable and signatory for quality plans, control plans, major changes and validations.
  • Responsible for communicating to all levels of the organization and integrating the brand quality plan into the overall product value stream with specific and quantifiable business outcomes.
  • This position is measured by the brand scorecard health which includes internal Quality metrics (NCs, Quality events), external Quality metrics (such as Customer complaints), Supply chain metrics (such as COGS) and Commercial metrics (such as adherence to BP).
  • Adheres to environmental policy and procedures and supports department environmental objectives.

Qualifications:

Education:

  • University / Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent is required. Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Statistics/Engineering/Science or Technical/MBA Degree or equivalent is preferred.

Experience and Skills:

Required:

  • 8-10 years of experience in Medical Device Industry, Statistics or Process Engineering.
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills.
  • Understanding of the New Product Introduction (NPI) process.
  • Thorough understanding of GMP/ISO regulations, validation regulations.
  • Strong leadership, mentoring skills.
  • Demonstrated management abilities.
  • Demonstrated leadership ability over several functions.
  • Business sense and experience.
  • Able to build cost savings and growth business cases.

Preferred:

  • 3+ years of experience in at least 2 of the 3 following domains: Quality, R&D & Manufacturing.
  • Understanding and application of principles, concepts and practices of statistical methods.
  • Excellent technical understanding of manufacturing equipment and processes.
  • Demonstrated experience in technical improvements process.

Other:

  • Up to 25% domestic and international travel is required.

Johnson & Johnson is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by federal, state or local law. We actively seek qualified candidates who are protected veterans and individuals with disabilities as defined under VEVRAA and Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act.

Johnson & Johnson is committed to providing an interview process that is inclusive of our applicants’ needs. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request an accommodation, external applicants please contact us via https://www.jnj.com/contact-us/careers. Internal employees contact AskGS to be directed to your accommodation resource.

#LI-Hybrid

Required Skills:

Preferred Skills:

Business Alignment, Collaborating, Compliance Management, Fact-Based Decision Making, Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), ISO 9001, Mentorship, Organizing, Quality Auditing, Quality Control (QC), Quality Management Systems (QMS), Quality Standards, Quality Validation, Regulatory Environment, Standard Operating Procedure (SOP), Tactical Thinking, Technical Credibility

The anticipated base pay range for this position is :

$122,000 - $212,750 • The expected base pay range for this position, in the Bay Area, is $142,000 - $244,950

Additional Description for Pay Transparency:

The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis. • Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance. • Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)). • Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits: o Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year o Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year o Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year of Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year • Additional information can be found through the link below. https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits The compensation and benefits information set forth in this posting applies to candidates hired in the United States. Candidates hired outside the United States will be eligible for compensation and benefits in accordance with their local market.

title: Product Compliance Engineer - Systems
description:
Apple’s Environmental Technologies team is seeking a highly motivated, detail-oriented Product Compliance Engineer for systems to drive critical software tools for Apple's environmental compliance efforts, supporting its Full Material Disclosure ecosystem and managing vital compliance tracking systems. In this role you will scope features and requirements, and guide business analysts in generating detailed user and system requirements. This role requires close partnership with a diverse set of stakeholders providing user and system requirements, and collaborating with software development leads to bridge non-technical asks to new features and capabilities, enabling Apple to achieve its environmental goals.

Description

This position is offered in Apple's Environmental Technologies group within Apple's Hardware Engineering division. Our mission is to deliver world-leading compliance tools to drive address the impacts of climate change, conserve resources, and utilize safer materials in our products.

As a Systems Compliance Engineer, you will be responsible for driving a key part of Apple’s compliance ecosystem. If you love collaborating with a wide range of people and are excited to grow your expertise in the rapidly developing regulatory environment, we would love to have you.","responsibilities":"Translate product compliance needs into strategic tool and feature execution plans.

Guide Business Analysts in gathering and translating complex requirements into detailed user stories and system requirements.

Own development and improvement of tools supporting key environmental compliance areas, such as materials/substances, recyclability, recycled content, energy efficiency, design for repair, and packaging.

Work with Engineering Technical Leads for design feasibility and optimized solutions

Lead backlog grooming, sprint planning, and user story refinement utilizing an agile framework

Gather inputs, and communicate feature development progress, challenges, and solutions, collaborating with a diverse stakeholder group

Identify opportunities for system integration, data flow optimization, and automation for efficiency

Champion user-centric design; ensure intuitive, efficient tools are developed to meet user needs

Collaborate on training, documentation; support successful rollout and adoption of new tools.

Preferred Qualifications

Master's degree in a relevant technical or environmental field

Experience with Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) systems

Familiar with chemical reporting frameworks and pertinent regulations (SCIP, RoHS, REACH)

Experience within the consumer electronics industry

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's in an Engineering Discipline, Computer Science, Environmental Science, or related technical field

5+ years Product Owner/Analyst experience in material compliance (or similar) data systems

Strong technical acumen: data models, architecture, software development

Proven product leadership: guiding roadmaps, creating user stories, maintaining backlogs; guiding business analysts

Excellent communication, analytical, problem-solving, and collaboration skills

Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and highly collaborative cross-functional team environment

title: Product Marketing Manager, Customer Success
description:
Overview

We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Product Marketing Manager to join the QuickBooks Customer Success Growth & Retention team. In this role, you will be responsible for delivering Quickbooks ecosystem growth by driving demand for our human and digital help amongst our high value customer cohorts. This position is ideal for someone with extensive experience in SaaS businesses, a proven track record of demand generation success, and a passion for creating value-driven customer experiences.


Responsibilities

  • Expand traffic for human and digital help amongst high value customers to expand opportunities for value added conversations, including opportunities to drive attach of QuickBooks products and services
  • Subscriber Retention and Growth: Support Quickbooks ecosystem growth by driving awareness and consideration of Quickbooks offerings (e.g., Payroll, Payments, QBLive Expert Services, etc).
  • Data-Driven Decision Making: Leverage analytics to evaluate campaign effectiveness, track customer response rates, and inform decision-making for optimizing future activities.
  • Customer Insights: Conduct customer segmentation and lifecycle analysis to develop tailored messaging and offers that resonate with each buyer persona.
  • Collaborative Partnership: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including customer success, marketing, product management, and analytics, to develop creative campaigns and drive cohesive outreach strategies.
  • Testing and Measurement: Design and execute A/B tests and experiments across multiple platforms, identifying what works best to drive subscriptions and product/service attachments.
  • Expert Enablement: Provide tools, resources, and content that enable customer success teams to convert leads and effectively communicate the value of our offerings.
  • Customer Success Knowledge: Hands-on experience working within or alongside customer success teams
  • Collaborative Problem-Solving: Comfortable working across teams in a matrixed organization while driving alignment toward business objectives.
  • Customer-Centric Approach: Passionate about helping customers succeed, staying empathetic to their challenges while advocating for solutions that drive measurable impact.


Qualifications

Qualifications:

  • Experience in SaaS Business Models: 5+ years of experience in demand generation, product marketing, or lifecycle marketing roles within a subscription-based SaaS company.
  • Demand Generation Expertise: Proven track record of driving subscriber growth and increasing product/service adoption through integrated marketing campaigns.
  • In-Product Marketing Proficiency: Experience partnering with product teams to design on-site and in-product engagement strategies that drive conversions and build customer interest.
  • Analytical Acumen: Strong ability to interpret customer data, campaign metrics, and subscription trends to improve marketing effectiveness and drive incremental revenue.
  • Customer Centricity: Deep understanding of customer needs and behavior, with a focus on delivering value that enhances their success and deepens their connection to the QuickBooks brand.
  • Collaboration Skills: Proven success working in cross-functional environments and influencing stakeholders in customer success, product, and marketing teams.
  • Creative and Innovative Thinking: Ability to craft innovative campaigns, test new approaches, and adapt strategies based on data insights and feedback.
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field; advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.
  • Experience marketing financial management solutions or related SaaS offerings highly desirable.
  • Familiarity with analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Tableau, or similar platforms for visualization and insights.
  • Understanding of subscription-based revenue metrics (e.g., churn, LTV, ARR/MRR, upsell/cross-sell rates).


Intuit provides a competitive compensation package with a strong pay for performance rewards approach. This position will be eligible for a cash bonus, equity rewards and benefits, in accordance with our applicable plans and programs (see more about our compensation and benefits at Intuit®: Careers | Benefits). Pay offered is based on factors such as job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and work location. To drive ongoing fair pay for employees, Intuit conducts regular comparisons across categories of ethnicity and gender.

  • Demand Generation Expertise: Proven track record of driving subscriber growth and increasing product/service adoption through integrated marketing campaigns.
  • In-Product Marketing Proficiency: Experience partnering with product teams to design on-site and in-product engagement strategies that drive conversions and build customer interest.
  • Analytical Acumen: Strong ability to interpret customer data, campaign metrics, and subscription trends to improve marketing effectiveness and drive incremental revenue.
  • Customer Centricity: Deep understanding of customer needs and behavior, with a focus on delivering value that enhances their success and deepens their connection to the QuickBooks brand.
  • Collaboration Skills: Proven success working in cross-functional environments and influencing stakeholders in customer success, product, and marketing teams.
  • Creative and Innovative Thinking: Ability to craft innovative campaigns, test new approaches, and adapt strategies based on data insights and feedback.
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field; advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.
  • Experience marketing financial management solutions or related SaaS offerings highly desirable.
  • Familiarity with analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Tableau, or similar platforms for visualization and insights.
  • Understanding of subscription-based revenue metrics (e.g., churn, LTV, ARR/MRR, upsell/cross-sell rates).


Intuit provides a competitive compensation package with a strong pay for performance rewards approach. title: Product Marketing Manager, Customer Success
description:

We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Product Marketing Manager to join the QuickBooks Customer Success Growth & Retention team. In this role, you will be responsible for delivering Quickbooks ecosystem growth by driving demand for our human and digital help amongst our high value customer cohorts. This position is ideal for someone with extensive experience in SaaS businesses, a proven track record of demand generation success, and a passion for creating value-driven customer experiences.

title: Sr. Product Manager, Vehicle & Order Matching
description:
What to Expect
As the Product Manager for Vehicle and Order Matching, you’ll own the systems responsible for routing vehicles to locations, assigning them to customers, and estimating delivery timing. This platform is critical to Tesla’s ability to scale — connecting sales, delivery, demand planning, logistics, engineering, and design to ensure every car reaches the right customer at the right time. You’ll combine automation, self-serve tools, and AI-powered intelligence to streamline operations, accelerate delivery speed, and create a frictionless customer journey. This is a high-impact role where precision, speed, and innovation directly translate into faster deliveries, higher efficiency, and greater customer trust.

What You'll Do
  • Define and drive the product vision, strategy, and roadmap for optimizing the vehicle and order matching across global markets
  • Design and deliver scalable, innovative solutions that simplify complex workflows through automation, AI agents, large language models (LLMs), and self-serve enterprise tools
  • Transform operational challenges into product features that empower internal teams and elevate the end-to-end customer experience
  • Write clear product requirements, prioritize ruthlessly, and partner with engineering and design to deliver innovative, high-quality solutions at speed
  • Leverage data, experimentation, and feedback to measure impact and continuously refine the platform for speed, accuracy, and conversion
  • Collaborate across functions and regions to adapt workflows to diverse market needs while maintaining simplicity, scalability, and consistency

What You'll Bring
  • Product management experience building internal enterprise tools that drive measurable impact on customer outcomes, ideally in allocation / optimization systems, supply chain, or automotive environments
  • Strong background in user experience design with a track record of simplifying and scaling complex systems for internal users and customer-facing impact
  • Experience managing products that connect physical operations with digital systems, balancing automation with human decision-making
  • Data-driven mindset with sharp analytical skills and a bias for experimentation and measurable outcomes
  • Exceptional collaboration and communication abilities to align diverse teams around ambitious goals
  • A customer-obsessed, entrepreneurial mindset that thrives in fast-paced, ambiguous environments

Compensation and Benefits
Benefits

Along with competitive pay, as a full-time Tesla employee, you are eligible for the following benefits at day 1 of hire:

  • Aetna PPO and HSA plans > 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction
  • Family-building, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits
  • Dental (including orthodontic coverage) and vision plans, both have options with a $0 paycheck contribution
  • Company Paid (Health Savings Account) HSA Contribution when enrolled in the High Deductible Aetna medical plan with HSA
  • Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
  • 401(k) with employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
  • Company paid Basic Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability insurance
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Sick and Vacation time (Flex time for salary positions), and Paid Holidays
  • Back-up childcare and parenting support resources
  • Voluntary benefits to include: critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, theft & legal services, and pet insurance
  • Weight Loss and Tobacco Cessation Programs
  • Tesla Babies program
  • Commuter benefits
  • Employee discounts and perks program
Expected Compensation
$128,000 - $192,000/annual salary + cash and stock awards + benefits

Pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.


Tesla is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

Tesla is also committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. Please let your recruiter know if you need an accommodation at any point during the interview process.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
Pay rate:
W2: 50-55
C2C: 60-65
Citizenship Requirement: US Citizen or Green Card Holder only

Detailed Position Summary

We are seeking a proactive, business-oriented Senior Business Systems Analyst to support one or more Port Divisions. This individual will serve as the primary liaison between the IM Division and the assigned Division, acting as both a strategic partner and an accountable delivery lead.

This role blends product ownership, business systems analysis, and project coordination, with a strong emphasis on technical execution and stakeholder engagement. The Senior Business Systems Analyst will work closely with business stakeholders to understand needs, define and refine business and technical requirements, manage a prioritized product backlog, and lead the successful delivery of high-impact solutions. Responsibilities will also include triaging ad hoc requests, performing data/process mapping, producing detailed documentation, and providing structured updates to IM leadership.

The ideal candidate brings strong professional presence, technical fluency, and the ability to operate autonomously. As a key representative of the IM team, the Senior Business Systems Analyst is expected to deliver responsive support to stakeholders while ensuring IM leadership is kept informed and aligned.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Other duties may be assigned.

1. Division-Facing Product & Delivery Leadership

  • Act as the primary liaison between the IM Division and assigned Division(s), serving as the single point of contact for all information technology related needs.
  • Champion a strategic and collaborative relationship with business stakeholders—proactively identifying needs, fostering trust, and ensuring responsive and professional engagement.
  • Conduct regular check-ins with stakeholders to review in-flight work, identify emerging priorities, and align on expectations.
  • Maintain and continuously refine a dynamic, prioritized backlog of requests; sequencing work based on urgency, business impact, and available capacity.
  • Lead delivery of key initiatives, serving as both Business Systems Analyst and Technical Product Owner from scoping through implementation.
  • Triage and coordinate resolution of incoming issues and ad hoc requests (e.g., data discrepancies, reporting fixes) in collaboration with SMEs and technical teams.
  • Deliver clear and timely updates to IM leadership, including dashboards, progress reports, and executive-ready briefings.
  • Translate evolving business needs into actionable plans, balancing strategic product vision with short-term service delivery needs.

2. Project Management & Delivery Oversight

  • Plan and execute initiatives using structured PMO frameworks and/or Agile methodologies, depending on the project context.
  • Manage timelines, deliverables, dependencies, and resources across the full project lifecycle.
  • Monitor scope, budget, and quality, escalating risks and issues to governance teams as appropriate.
  • Provide consistent progress reporting and ensure transparent communication with stakeholders and leadership.

3. Business Analysis & Requirements Definition

  • Translate business challenges into well-structured, traceable functional and technical requirements.
  • Facilitate discovery sessions, process mapping, and stakeholder interviews to capture current-state workflows and define solution needs.
  • Partner with business units to define measurable success criteria and support adoption planning.
  • Ensure technical deliverables meet business expectations through proactive alignment and validation.

4. Stakeholder Engagement & Communication

  • Serve as a conduit between business users, developers and executive leadership; ensuring clear communication and shared understanding.
  • Lead requirements walkthroughs, demos, and working sessions to drive alignment and gather feedback.
  • Communicate priorities, constraints, and trade-offs in a clear, audience-appropriate manner.

5. Vendor & Contract Coordination

  • Manage vendor engagement across the delivery lifecycle, from design and development to implementation and support.
  • Monitor vendor deliverables, timelines, and risks; escalate concerns proactively.
  • Assist with software procurement, license renewals, and contract negotiations as needed.

6. Governance & Risk Management

  • Maintain a RAID (Risks, Actions, Issues, Decisions) log to support transparency and accountability.
  • Participate in change control and governance processes to ensure proper oversight.
  • Proactively identify, communicate, and mitigate delivery risks and blockers.

Required Knowledge and Experience

  • 10–15 years of progressive experience in hybrid roles spanning product ownership, business systems analysis, and project delivery; ideally within enterprise IT or public sector environments.
  • Demonstrated ability to operate independently in dynamic, fast-paced settings, managing multiple priorities and shifting demands with minimal supervision.
  • Proven strength in facilitation and cross-functional communication, with the ability to engage both technical teams and business stakeholders effectively.
  • Experienced in proactively driving stakeholder alignment, resolving competing priorities, and navigating organizational complexity with professionalism.
  • Background in client-facing roles, such as management consulting or stakeholder liaison functions—serving as the bridge between business needs and technical execution, and ensuring visibility at the executive level.
  • Exceptional written communication skills, capable of producing clear, concise, and tailored documentation, from technical specs to executive summaries.
  • Consistent track record of delivering meaningful outcomes, not just documentation—focused on value realization and impact.
  • Adept at introducing structure in ambiguous or evolving environments, with a strong orientation toward clarity and execution.
  • Proficient with key tools such as:
  • a. Azure DevOps, Jirab. Microsoft Project, Smartsheetc. Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, Miro
  • Solid understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC), Agile methodologies, and structured PMO or governance frameworks.Core Competencies & Working Style
  • Builds credibility and trust quickly through strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills.
  • Naturally proactive, resourceful, and inquisitive—drives work forward without waiting for direction.
  • Demonstrates a high level of ownership and accountability, consistently following through and closing the loop with all stakeholders.
  • Possesses strong situational awareness, with the ability to tailor messaging and tone to diverse audiences and political contexts.
  • Comfortable working through ambiguity—asks the right questions, surfaces assumptions, and identifies actionable paths forward.
  • Maintains professionalism, discretion, and maturity, especially in high-visibility or politically sensitive environments.

Desired Skills, Education and Certifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
  • MBA or equivalent graduate degree preferred but not required.
  • Project Management Professional, Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO), SAFe Product Owner/Product Manager, or equivalent certifications.
  • Demonstrated success operating as both an executor and a thought partner—balancing hands-on delivery with strategic planning.
  • Familiarity with ITSM, enterprise system implementations, or organizational change management frameworks.
  • Prior experience serving as a trusted liaison between business and technical teams, ideally in a consulting, client-facing, or cross-functional delivery role.
  • Consulting experience with public sector or large matrixed organizations strongly preferred.

Physical Requirements and Working Conditions

This position is structured as a hybrid role, with the consultant working both on site in Long Beach two to three days and remotely during Pacific Time business hours. Fully remote arrangements may be considered only when an accommodation is required. The position requires extended periods of sitting, standing, and computer-based work, and may involve occasional travel for on-site meetings, trainings, and workshops.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $50.00 - $55.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Application Question(s):

  • Familiarity with ITSM, enterprise system implementations, or organizational change management frameworks?

Experience:

  • Consulting with public sector: 1 year (Preferred)
  • large matrixed organizations: 1 year (Preferred)
  • hybrid roles spanning product ownership: 10 years (Required)
  • business systems analysis: 10 years (Required)
  • project delivery within enterprise IT or public sector: 10 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

  • PMP or equivalent certifications (Required)
  • CSPO or equivalent certifications (Required)

Location:

  • Long Beach, CA (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

  • Long Beach, CA (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Assistant Product Manager
description:

title: Web Product Manager
description:
You’ll be joining Adobe on a contract opportunity, employed through NextDeavor.

Benefits You’ll Love

NextDeavor offers health, vision and dental benefits for contract employees

Paid sick leave eligibility is contingent on state of residence

Optional 401k Plan (excludes employer match)

Opportunity to get your foot in the door at a well-established corporation, with potential for extended or permanent full-time employment

Become a Key Player as a Web Product Manager, Business Professionals

As a Web Product Manager, Business Professionals, you will drive acquisition and engagement for Adobe’s Business Professional segment on Adobe.com, focusing on Adobe Express and Adobe Acrobat. You’ll partner with Design, Engineering, Sales, Product, Legal, and Customer Support to deliver site experiences, run experiments, and meet business goals. Work model: Onsite (in-office presence required in San Francisco or San Jose). This is a staffing engagement expected to run from 12/01/2025 to 11/27/2026 at 40 hours per week.

Here’s How You’ll Make an Impact on the Team

Use data, customer insights, and industry benchmarks to identify opportunities and craft compelling user experiences.

Collaborate cross-functionally to conceptualize, prototype, validate in market, and launch new ideas and innovations.

Define measurable goals and metrics; set priorities; manage a backlog; partner with engineering, design, and QA to deliver.

Build and prioritize a 6–12 month roadmap, making thoughtful trade-offs across quality, customer value, and schedule.

Design and run discovery and optimization experiments using quantitative (A/B) and qualitative techniques.

Identify, prioritize, and drive resolution of project issues.

Assess and report initiative results against KPI targets.

Present concepts, business rationale, and key findings to partners and senior leaders to influence decisions.

Engage with regional sales and product marketing on go-to-market plans.

Here’s What You’ll Need to Be Successful in This Role

MBA or BA/BS with 5 years of product management or equivalent experience.

Experience building site experiences informed by research, customer needs, and data.

Proven leadership of complete end-to-end product life cycles.

Excellence in multivariate testing, rapid iteration, and applying insights to product innovation.

Proficiency defining roadmaps and delivering with agile teams; experience writing detailed product requirements and user stories.

Ability to resolve issues and mitigate risks to the product roadmap.

Highly analytical; use data to drive decisions and achieve measurable key results for the site.

Experience navigating complex, ambiguous problem spaces and open-ended design projects.

Self-starter with a track record of initiating new efforts and resolving complex issues through analysis.

Results-focused, detail-oriented, and effective working across all organizational levels and with partners.

Excellent written and verbal communication; able to influence engineers, senior executives, and customers.

Ability to craft clear, analytical recommendations and gain organizational support.

Familiarity with experience design, including user research, usability testing, and journey mapping.

Ability to manage multiple initiatives and shift priorities as needed.

Comfortable switching between high-level strategy and day-to-day implementation.

Pay Range

$38.87 - $48.59/hour

Ready to Make Your Mark?

This role may fill quickly. Submit your resume to be considered.

Pay: $38.87 - $48.59 per hour
